definition: thousands of horses, all mute (idiom); no-one dares to speak out/an atmosphere of political oppression
surname Wan
ten thousand/a great number
see 万俟[Mo4 qi2]
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
(name of states and dynasties at several different periods)/surname Qi
neat/even/level with/identical/simultaneous/all together/to even sth out
mute

sentences.english: Or take the analogy brown, black was immobility.
sentences.chinese: 还是棕色比拟搭，黑色显万马齐喑。

sentences.english: The very earth trembled as with the tramps of horses and murmur of angry men.
sentences.chinese: 连大地都震动了，宛若万马齐喑，千夫怒吼。

sentences.english: At that time, the scenes can be called Wanmabenteng.
sentences.chinese: 当时地场景可谓是万马齐喑。

sentences.english: Ming Wanghou, China is in the dark ages, the nobody expressing an opinion, the people have no means to make a living.
sentences.chinese: 明亡后，中国处于黑暗时代，万马齐喑，民不聊生。

definition: lit. plaintive whine of geese (idiom); fig. land swarming with disaster victims/starving people fill the land
lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
fire beacons on all sides (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
lit. wind and rain darken the sky (idiom); fig. the situation looks grim
lit. fire beacons in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
the fire of war in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
lit. wind sighing and crane calling (idiom)/fig. to panic at the slightest move/to be jittery
to shut one's eyes and stop one's ears/out of touch with reality/to bury one's head in the sand
precarious as pile of eggs (idiom); ready to fall and break at any moment/in a dangerous state
a hundred flowers bloom, a hundred schools of thought contend (idiom); refers to the classical philosophic schools of the Warring States period 475-221 BC, but adopted for Mao's campaign of 1956
pinyin: bai3 hua1 qi2 fang4 , bai3 jia1 zheng1 ming2

definition: uninspired/dejected/discouraged
a hundred flowers bloom (idiom); let the arts have free expression
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
unique/unprecedented (idiom)
pinyin: qian2 bu4 jian4 gu3 ren2 , hou4 bu4 jian4 lai2 zhe3
related.word: 前不见古人，后不见来者
